##
simontsui at 2024-03-06T17:24:16.635Z ##

@avoidthehack CISA added CVE-2023-23225 and CVE-2024-23296 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog today: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/03/06/cisa-adds-two-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

##
avoidthehack at 2024-03-06T17:20:02.569Z ##

#iOS 17.4 includes 4 important #security fixes, 2 were exploited

Update ASAP.

Zero-day exploits for a kernel flaw (CVE-2024-23225) and RTKit flaw (CVE-2024-23296), both when exploited bypassed kernel memory protections have been patched by #Apple.

Also a #privacy patch included in the Accessibility feature (CVE-2024-23243); apps could read "sensitive location information" and a bug in Safari Private Browsing exposed locked tabs while switching tab groups (CVE-2024-23256).

Other security fixes are also included in iOS 17.4, but the additional CVE entries will be added later.

#cybersecurity #update #exploitation #cve

https://9to5mac.com/2024/03/05/ios-17-4-fixes-4-security-flaws/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-03-06T13:27:38.501Z ##

The two bugs were found in the iOS Kernel (CVE-2024-23225) and RTKit (CVE-2024-23296), both allowing attackers with arbitrary kernel read and write capabilities to bypass kernel memory protections. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/apple/apple-fixes-two-new-ios-zero-days-exploited-in-attacks-on-iphones/

##

##

CVE-2024-23225
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-03-07T19:15:11.630000

19 posts

A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.7.6 and iPadOS 16.7.6, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An attacker with arbitrary kernel read and write capability may be able to bypass kernel memory protections. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-03-05T21:40:07.000Z ##

Apple Blunts Zero-Day Attacks With iOS 17.4 Update https://www.securityweek.com/apple-blunts-zero-day-attacks-with-ios-17-4-update/ #Mobile&Wireless #Vulnerabilities #CVE202423225 #CVE202423296 #ZeroDay #IOS174

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-03-05T21:40:05.000Z ##

Apple Blunts Zero-Day Attacks With iOS 17.4 Update https://www.securityweek.com/apple-blunts-zero-day-attacks-with-ios-17-4-update/ #Mobile&Wireless #Vulnerabilities #CVE202423225 #CVE202423296 #ZeroDay #IOS174

##
simontsui at 2024-03-07T19:00:53.906Z ##

Apple released additional security advisories, each one containing one or both of the recently disclosed exploited zero-days CVE-2024-23225 and CVE-2024-23296, which were added to the CISA KEV Catalog on 06 March 2024:

  • About the security content of macOS Monterey 12.7.4
  • About the security content of macOS Sonoma 14.4
  • About the security content of macOS Ventura 13.6.5
  • About the security content of tvOS 17.4
  • About the security content of visionOS 1.1
  • About the security content of watchOS 10.4

Edit: About the security content of Safari 17.4
 nothing exploited.

No new zero-days.

#Apple #zeroday #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #CVE_2024_23225 #CVE_2024_23296 #CISA #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #KEV #vulnerability

🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/03/06/cisa-adds-two-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

#iOS 17.4 includes 4 important #security fixes, 2 were exploited

Update ASAP.

Zero-day exploits for a kernel flaw (CVE-2024-23225) and RTKit flaw (CVE-2024-23296), both when exploited bypassed kernel memory protections have been patched by #Apple.

Also a #privacy patch included in the Accessibility feature (CVE-2024-23243); apps could read "sensitive location information" and a bug in Safari Private Browsing exposed locked tabs while switching tab groups (CVE-2024-23256).

Other security fixes are also included in iOS 17.4, but the additional CVE entries will be added later.

##

CVE-2023-36049
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2023-11-21T19:25:39.530000

2 posts

.NET, .NET Framework, and Visual Studio Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

thezdi at 2024-03-06T17:09:15.605Z ##

In our latest guest blog, the Trend Micro Research team details CVE-2023-36049 - a .NET LPE bug originally found by ZDI's own @chudypb. An attacker could write/delete arbitrary files in the context of the FTP server. Read all the details at https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/3/6/cve-2023-36049-microsoft-net-crlf-injection-arbitrary-file-writedeletion-vulnerability

##
thezdi@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-06T17:09:15.000Z ##

In our latest guest blog, the Trend Micro Research team details CVE-2023-36049 - a .NET LPE bug originally found by ZDI's own @chudypb. An attacker could write/delete arbitrary files in the context of the FTP server. Read all the details at https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/3/6/cve-2023-36049-microsoft-net-crlf-injection-arbitrary-file-writedeletion-vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-4294
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2023-11-07T04:22:25.913000

2 posts

The URL Shortify WordPress plugin before 1.7.6 does not properly escape the value of the referer header, thus allowing an unauthenticated attacker to inject malicious javascript that will trigger in the plugins admin panel with statistics of the created short link.

1 repos

https://github.com/b0marek/CVE-2023-4294

##

CVE-2024-21836
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-02-26T18:15:07.487000

1 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the GGUF library header.n_tensors functionality of llama.cpp Commit 18c2e17. A specially crafted .gguf file can lead to code execution. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

philippclassen at 2024-03-03T22:48:14.407Z ##

When running local LLMs, some care should be taken when using untrusted models.

An obvious problem exists with models that include unsafe format like "pickle" for serializing their weights (https://jfrog.com/blog/data-scientists-targeted-by-malicious-hugging-face-ml-models-with-silent-backdoor/).

Fortunately, most models now are using safetensors or .gguf, which do not require code execution. However, even with these safe formats, bugs in the inference engines can be exploited.

For instance, llama.cpp recently fixed some overflows that could be exploited by a malicious .gguf to run arbitrary code:
* https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-23496
* https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-21802
* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21836

That is not surprising, but it is a reminder to keep software up-to-date - including inference engines.

When running agents that use generative AI (e.g. via APIs like ChatGPT or Gemini), there are also new attack vectors being found.Recently, the Morris II AI Prompt Worm demonstrates an attack on email assistance agents:

https://sites.google.com/view/compromptmized

#security #llm #ai #llamacpp

##

CVE-2024-23496
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-02-26T18:15:07.580000

1 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the GGUF library gguf_fread_str functionality of llama.cpp Commit 18c2e17. A specially crafted .gguf file can lead to code execution. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

philippclassen at 2024-03-03T22:48:14.407Z ##

When running local LLMs, some care should be taken when using untrusted models.

An obvious problem exists with models that include unsafe format like "pickle" for serializing their weights (https://jfrog.com/blog/data-scientists-targeted-by-malicious-hugging-face-ml-models-with-silent-backdoor/).

Fortunately, most models now are using safetensors or .gguf, which do not require code execution. However, even with these safe formats, bugs in the inference engines can be exploited.

For instance, llama.cpp recently fixed some overflows that could be exploited by a malicious .gguf to run arbitrary code:
* https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-23496
* https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-21802
* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21836

That is not surprising, but it is a reminder to keep software up-to-date - including inference engines.

When running agents that use generative AI (e.g. via APIs like ChatGPT or Gemini), there are also new attack vectors being found.Recently, the Morris II AI Prompt Worm demonstrates an attack on email assistance agents:

https://sites.google.com/view/compromptmized

#security #llm #ai #llamacpp

##

CVE-2024-21802
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-02-26T18:15:07.290000

1 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the GGUF library info->ne functionality of llama.cpp Commit 18c2e17. A specially crafted .gguf file can lead to code execution. An attacker can provide a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

philippclassen at 2024-03-03T22:48:14.407Z ##

When running local LLMs, some care should be taken when using untrusted models.

An obvious problem exists with models that include unsafe format like "pickle" for serializing their weights (https://jfrog.com/blog/data-scientists-targeted-by-malicious-hugging-face-ml-models-with-silent-backdoor/).

Fortunately, most models now are using safetensors or .gguf, which do not require code execution. However, even with these safe formats, bugs in the inference engines can be exploited.

For instance, llama.cpp recently fixed some overflows that could be exploited by a malicious .gguf to run arbitrary code:
* https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-23496
* https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-21802
* https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21836

That is not surprising, but it is a reminder to keep software up-to-date - including inference engines.

When running agents that use generative AI (e.g. via APIs like ChatGPT or Gemini), there are also new attack vectors being found.Recently, the Morris II AI Prompt Worm demonstrates an attack on email assistance agents:

https://sites.google.com/view/compromptmized

#security #llm #ai #llamacpp

##

CVE-2023-48365
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2023-11-29T20:43:54.133000

2 posts

Qlik Sense Enterprise for Windows before August 2023 Patch 2 allows unauthenticated remote code execution, aka QB-21683. Due to improper validation of HTTP headers, a remote attacker is able to elevate their privilege by tunneling HTTP requests, allowing them to execute HTTP requests on the backend server that hosts the repository application. The fixed versions are August 2023 Patch 2, May 2023 P

1 repos

#search_error

simontsui at 2024-03-08T13:41:14.938Z ##

Check Point Research (CPR) reports on a financially motivated threat actor called Magnet Goblin, that leverages "1-day" vulnerabilities in public facing applications. This included Ivanti Connect Secure CVE-2024-21887 within 1 day of Proof of Concept. CPR attributed Magento, Qlink Sense and possibly Apache ActiveMQ campaigns to Magnet Goblin. They also discovered a Linux version of a malware called NerbianRAT, and use of the WARPWIRE JavaScript credential stealer (unknown if there are overlaps with Mandiant's UNC5325 threat actor). Magnet Goblin uses MiniNerbian (a small Linux backdoor) and RMM tools like ScreenConnect and AnyDesk. IOC provided.
🔗 https://research.checkpoint.com/2024/magnet-goblin-targets-publicly-facing-servers-using-1-day-vulnerabilities/

#MagnetGoblin #cybercrime #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2022_24086 #CVE_2023_41265 #CVE_2023_41266 #CVE_2023_48365 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #NerbianRAT #WARPWIRE #MiniNerbian #ScreenConnect #AnyDesk

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-08T13:41:14.000Z ##

Check Point Research (CPR) reports on a financially motivated threat actor called Magnet Goblin, that leverages "1-day" vulnerabilities in public facing applications. This included Ivanti Connect Secure CVE-2024-21887 within 1 day of Proof of Concept. CPR attributed Magento, Qlink Sense and possibly Apache ActiveMQ campaigns to Magnet Goblin. They also discovered a Linux version of a malware called NerbianRAT, and use of the WARPWIRE JavaScript credential stealer (unknown if there are overlaps with Mandiant's UNC5325 threat actor). Magnet Goblin uses MiniNerbian (a small Linux backdoor) and RMM tools like ScreenConnect and AnyDesk. IOC provided.
🔗 https://research.checkpoint.com/2024/magnet-goblin-targets-publicly-facing-servers-using-1-day-vulnerabilities/

#MagnetGoblin #cybercrime #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2022_24086 #CVE_2023_41265 #CVE_2023_41266 #CVE_2023_48365 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #NerbianRAT #WARPWIRE #MiniNerbian #ScreenConnect #AnyDesk

##

CVE-2024-21338
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2024-03-05T02:00:01.990000

15 posts

Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/crackmapEZec/CVE-2024-21338-POC

simontsui at 2024-03-05T00:07:57.678Z ##

Increased scrutiny on Microsoft as @dangoodin writes for Ars Technica: Hackers exploited Windows 0-day for 6 months after Microsoft knew of it. Microsoft only announced two exploited zero-days during their February 2024 Patch Tuesday, but botched an update to a third exploited zero-day CVE-2024-21410 (accidentally updating CVE-2024-21413 instead). Now, Avast claimed that CVE-2024-21338 was exploited in the wild since at least August 2023 (date that they notified Microsoft with a PoC).

#CISA #KEV #CVE_2024_21338 #vulnerability #IOCTL #EoP #Avast #eitw #activeexploitation #MSRC #Microsoft

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T21:04:57.969Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) quietly updated its security advisory for CVE-2024-21338 following the Avast blog post on 28 February 2024 claiming zero-day exploitation. Version 1.2 for Feb 28, 2024 reads "Updated the Exploitability Index to 0 - Exploitation Detected and Exploited to Yes. This is an informational change only."

Analyst Note: This quiet update did not occur on 28 February as suggested, as multiple people in the infosec community were checking it, and the RSS feed for it did not get updated. This puts the total number of exploited zero-days in February 2024 up to FOUR.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21338

cc: @todb

#CISA #KEV #CVE_2024_21338 #vulnerability #IOCTL #EoP #Avast #eitw #activeexploitation #MSRC #Microsoft

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T16:07:55.931Z ##

CISA adds CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This was reported by Avast researchers to be exploited by North Korean APT Lazarus Group previously as a zero-day in the wild.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/03/04/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

#CISA #KEV #CVE_2024_21338 #vulnerability #IOCTL #EoP #Avast #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui at 2024-02-28T13:39:35.309Z ##

Avast reports that the North Korean state-sponsored APT Lazarus Group exploited CVE-2024-21338 (7.8 high, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Microsoft) Windows Kernel Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability previously as a zero-day. Avast doesn't provide a timeline, but states that they recreated Proof of Concept and submitted it in August 2023.
🔗 https://decoded.avast.io/janvojtesek/lazarus-and-the-fudmodule-rootkit-beyond-byovd-with-an-admin-to-kernel-zero-day/

cc: @campuscodi

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21338 #EoP #Avast #Lazarus #NorthKorea #cyberespionage

##
jbhall56 at 2024-03-03T14:40:20.480Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-21338, the security flaw was found by Avast Senior Malware Researcher Jan Vojtěšek in the appid.sys Windows AppLocker driver and reported to Microsoft last August as an actively exploited zero-day. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/windows-kernel-bug-fixed-last-month-exploited-as-zero-day-since-august

##
simontsui at 2024-02-28T19:27:47.904Z ##

@todb you're responding to an automated account. I've read the website's blog posts, and while they provide quick commentary, it lacks substance in my opinion.

Yeah I had issues with how Avast keeps calling it a zero-day but there's no timeline available, and that Microsoft does not list it as Exploited.

"We developed a custom PoC (Proof of Concept) exploit and submitted it in August 2023 as part of a vulnerability report to Microsoft, leading to an advisory for CVE-2024-21338 in the February Patch Tuesday update."

They sat on what they call an ITW 0-day for at least 6 months if we take that quote at face value.

##

CVE-2024-21320
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-01-12T17:14:04.587000

2 posts

Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-03-08T22:38:48.911Z ##

Akamai posts vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21320 (6.5 medium, disclosed 09 January 2024 by Microsoft), a Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability. The vulnerability can trigger an authentication coercion (NTLM hashes over SMB) to an attacker’s machine which can be cracked offline. The victim only needs to download and view the file, for the automatic sending of (SMB) handshake packets that contain credentials to the attacker’s server. Proof of Concept and mitigation recommendations provided.
🔗 https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/2024/mar/leaking-ntlm-credentials-through-windows-themes

#Microsoft #Akamai #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21320 #WindowsThemes #spoofing

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-08T22:38:48.000Z ##

Akamai posts vulnerability details for CVE-2024-21320 (6.5 medium, disclosed 09 January 2024 by Microsoft), a Windows Themes Spoofing Vulnerability. The vulnerability can trigger an authentication coercion (NTLM hashes over SMB) to an attacker’s machine which can be cracked offline. The victim only needs to download and view the file, for the automatic sending of (SMB) handshake packets that contain credentials to the attacker’s server. Proof of Concept and mitigation recommendations provided.
🔗 https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/2024/mar/leaking-ntlm-credentials-through-windows-themes

#Microsoft #Akamai #vulnerability #CVE_2024_21320 #WindowsThemes #spoofing

CVE-2024-0778
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-02-29T01:43:28.610000

2 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, has been found in Uniview ISC 2500-S up to 20210930. Affected by this issue is the function setNatConfig of the file /Interface/DevManage/VM.php. The manipulation of the argument natAddress/natPort/natServerPort leads to os command injection. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The identifi

simontsui at 2024-03-06T17:50:13.535Z ##

Akamai reports on a Mirai malware variant called NetKiller.Condi Botnet exploiting CVE-2024-0778 (9.8 critical), an OS command injection in Zhejiang Uniview ISC camera model 2500-S. The threat actor behind the attacks also targeted other URIs with different payloads, indicating that multiple system architectures are being targeted. C2 IP associated with the attacks are based in Vietnam. The earliest known reference to this activity dates back to June 28, 2023, indicating a prolonged and evolving threat. IOC provided.
🔗 https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/netkiller-condi-botnet-exploits-camera

#Mirai #Condi #botnet #CVE_2024_0778 #Uniview #threatintel #IOC

updated 2024-03-05T02:15:27.493000

1 posts

Supabase PostgreSQL v15.1 was discovered to contain a SQL injection vulnerability via the component /pg_meta/default/query. NOTE: the vendor's position is that this is an intended feature; also, it exists in the Supabase dashboard product, not the Supabase PostgreSQL product. Specifically, /pg_meta/default/query is for SQL queries that are entered in an intended UI by an authorized user. Nothing i

RegisHaubourg@mastodon.social at 2024-02-26T15:02:11.000Z ##

#postgresql folks, #QGIS security list is flooded by false positive of CVE's concerning only the server, and not the client libraries.
Is that something you are aware of ?

Is it the scanner vendors that do not distinguish CVES between client and server, or is it linked to postgresql CVE process?

It seems the NIST list does not distinguish server and client : https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-24213

any idea how to solve this ?

##

CVE-2023-52161
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-03-08T03:15:06.307000

1 posts

The Access Point functionality in eapol_auth_key_handle in eapol.c in iNet wireless daemon (IWD) before 2.14 allows attackers to gain unauthorized access to a protected Wi-Fi network. An attacker can complete the EAPOL handshake by skipping Msg2/4 and instead sending Msg4/4 with an all-zero key.

alexrad at 2024-02-26T22:10:47.019Z ##

CVE-2023-52161: inet-wireless daemon (iwd) APs allowed clients to connect with a NULL key, bypassing the WiFi password

https://www.top10vpn.com/research/wifi-vulnerabilities/

##

CVE-2024-0692
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-03-01T14:04:04.827000

18 posts

The SolarWinds Security Event Manager was susceptible to Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows an unauthenticated user to abuse SolarWinds’ service, resulting in remote code execution.

simontsui at 2024-03-05T12:41:13.844Z ##

The individual landing page for SolarWinds' CVE-2024-0692 (8.8 high, disclosed 01 March 2024 by Zero Day Initiative), Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability came out. I'm glad that I rely on other methods instead of just RSS, because the SolarWinds RSS updated 4 days later.
🔗 https://www.solarwinds.com/trust-center/security-advisories/cve-2024-0692

#SolarWInds #SecurityEventManager #CVE_2024_0692 #vulnerability #ZDI

##
kpwn at 2024-03-03T20:47:54.044Z ##

Nothing to see here. Just a small test in Prod :P

#CVE_2024_0692

##
simontsui at 2024-03-01T21:54:16.423Z ##

An anonymous researcher submitted CVE-2024-0692 through Zero Day Initiative. While ZDI marked it as 9.8 critical severity (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H), SolarWinds considers Attack Vector to be Adjacent (AV:A), which reduced the CVSSv3 score to 8.8. Unfortunately, NVD trusts SolarWinds and will likely not audit it. Still an RCE worth 9.8 to me.
🔗 https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-215/

#SolarWInds #SecurityEventManager #CVE_2024_0692 #vulnerability #ZDI

##
simontsui at 2024-03-01T21:40:04.267Z ##

SolarWinds security advisory for Security Event Manager: CVE-2024-0692 (8.8 high) Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. There are 4 third party introduced vlunerabilities too. No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://documentation.solarwinds.com/en/success_center/sem/content/release_notes/sem_2023-4-1_release_notes.htm

#SolarWInds #SecurityEventManager #CVE_2024_0692 #vulnerability

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T23:10:54.299Z ##

Computer Weekly takes interest in the JetBrains-Rapid7 feud. "At the core of the disagreement lies a difference in approaches to vulnerability disclosure and patching." They neglected to mention JetBrains's explicitly stating "At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7"
🔗 https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366572453/Rapid7-hits-out-over-botched-vulnerability-disclosure

Shoutout to @todb who was quoted from a 2022 Rapid7 blog post:

With this in mind, said Beardsley, silent patching in fact limits knowledge of the patched vulnerability to skilled exploit developers, that is to say threat actors, so while it is true that silent patching cuts out casual, low-skilled hackers and script kiddies, it also excludes the good guys, legitimate pen testers, the developers of defensive technologies, incident responders, and the entire cyber community who might benefit from being able to understand the issue better and communicate it effectively.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T16:42:41.230Z ##

Why you should care about the new JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2024-27198 (9.8 critical):

  • On 18 October 2023, Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau by the US Government) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also publicly attributed to RGB by the US Government) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.
  • On 13 December 2023, CISA published a cybersecurity advisory reporting that the Russian state-sponsored APT29 (Cozy Bear, publicly attributed to Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the USG) was mass-exploiting CVE-2023-42793 since September 2023.
  • From public disclosure to proof of concept was 6 days. Exploitation was within 7 days after that (KEV Catalog in 15 days). Nation-state abuse within 12-22 days of public disclosure.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T16:11:10.900Z ##

JetBrains tries to save face by responding to Rapid7's blog post with clarifications. It comes off accusatory and defends their attempt to silently patch. cc: @catc0n @campuscodi @serghei @jgreig
🔗 https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

To reiterate, we never had any intention to release a fix silently without making the full details public. As a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), we assigned CVE IDs for both issues a day after receiving the report.

We suggested disclosing the details of the vulnerabilities in the same way we have followed in the past (with a time delay between releasing a fix and making a full disclosure), which allows our customers to upgrade their TeamCity instances.

This suggestion was rejected by the Rapid7 team who published full details of the vulnerabilities (and how to exploit them) a few hours after we had released a fix to TeamCity customers.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T13:44:21.638Z ##

@jwarminsky @jgreig ShadowServer is seeing exploitation activity for CVE-2024-27198 since yesterday evening (2200 UTC) with at least 16 IPs scanning. It is likely to be added to CISA's KEV Catalog at this rate.
🔗 https://infosec.exchange/@shadowserver/112042621949812462

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
StaceyHolleran at 2024-03-04T19:42:16.187Z ##

Rapid7 has disclosed 2 authentication bypass vulnerabilities, #CVE_2024_27198 and #CVE_2024_27199 affecting JetBrains TeamCity CI/CD server. The most severe of which allows for unauthenticated RCE. https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

##
simontsui at 2024-03-04T19:33:44.520Z ##

Rapid7 provides technical analyses into JetBrains TeamCity vulnerabilities CVE-2024-27198 and CVE-2024-27199, both of which they consider to be authentication bypasses. They provide what are effectively Proofs of Concept, even if the words "poc" or "proof" aren't used. Rapid7 notes what an indicator of compromise would appear as for CVE-2024-27198. Timeline has an interesting exchange between JetBrains and Rapid7 regarding silent patching.
🔗 https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

cc: @ntkramer @catc0n

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199 #Rapid7 #Poc #proofofconcept

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-07T20:47:36.000Z ##

CISA adds only CVE-2024-27198 (9.8 critical) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog. This is despite two different security companies reporting CVE-2024-27199 exploitation in addition.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/03/07/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-jetbrains-vulnerability-cve-2024-27198-catalog

cc: @todb

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T23:10:54.000Z ##

Computer Weekly takes interest in the JetBrains-Rapid7 feud. "At the core of the disagreement lies a difference in approaches to vulnerability disclosure and patching." They neglected to mention JetBrains's explicitly stating "At this point, we made a decision not to make a coordinated disclosure with Rapid7"
🔗 https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366572453/Rapid7-hits-out-over-botched-vulnerability-disclosure

Shoutout to @todb who was quoted from a 2022 Rapid7 blog post:

With this in mind, said Beardsley, silent patching in fact limits knowledge of the patched vulnerability to skilled exploit developers, that is to say threat actors, so while it is true that silent patching cuts out casual, low-skilled hackers and script kiddies, it also excludes the good guys, legitimate pen testers, the developers of defensive technologies, incident responders, and the entire cyber community who might benefit from being able to understand the issue better and communicate it effectively.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T16:42:41.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2024-27198 (9.8 critical):

  • On 18 October 2023, Microsoft observed North Korean state-sponsored APTs Diamond Sleet (aka Lazarus Group, publicly attributed to 110 Research Center 3rd Technical Surveillance Bureau of Reconnaissance General Bureau by the US Government) and Onyx Sleet (aka Andariel, also publicly attributed to RGB by the US Government) exploiting a similar JetBrains TeamCity authentication bypass vulnerability CVE-2023-42793.
  • On 13 December 2023, CISA published a cybersecurity advisory reporting that the Russian state-sponsored APT29 (Cozy Bear, publicly attributed to Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) by the USG) was mass-exploiting CVE-2023-42793 since September 2023.
  • From public disclosure to proof of concept was 6 days. Exploitation was within 7 days after that (KEV Catalog in 15 days). Nation-state abuse within 12-22 days of public disclosure.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T16:11:10.000Z ##

JetBrains tries to save face by responding to Rapid7's blog post with clarifications. It comes off accusatory and defends their attempt to silently patch. cc: @catc0n @campuscodi @serghei @jgreig
🔗 https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

To reiterate, we never had any intention to release a fix silently without making the full details public. As a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), we assigned CVE IDs for both issues a day after receiving the report.

We suggested disclosing the details of the vulnerabilities in the same way we have followed in the past (with a time delay between releasing a fix and making a full disclosure), which allows our customers to upgrade their TeamCity instances.

This suggestion was rejected by the Rapid7 team who published full details of the vulnerabilities (and how to exploit them) a few hours after we had released a fix to TeamCity customers.

##
SophosXOps at 2024-03-07T00:48:51.084Z ##

Meanwhile, Sophos X-Ops’s MDR service and other defensive-security outfits around the industry have seen active attacks, or attack attempts, against multiple customers. So less than 100 hours since the first whisperings of trouble with TeamCity, we’re all in the thick of it. Best get to patching.

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/
👁️

##
SophosXOps at 2024-03-07T00:47:49.081Z ##

The best option is for anyone using the on-prem version of the platform to upgrade immediately to version 2023.11.4 – all versions prior to that are vulnerable. Second-best option is to apply a plug-in patch, which the company’s also made available, until the full upgrade can be done.

https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/
👁️

##
SophosXOps at 2024-03-07T00:47:09.725Z ##

As most security folk are aware, TeamCity pushed out information on these two CVEs over the weekend. Both vulnerabilities are critical-class issues that would allow an attacker – unauthenticated, with merely HTTP(S) access – to bypass auth checks and get administrative control of the TeamCity server. CVE-2024-27198’s authentication bypass weighs in at a robust 9.8 CVSS base score; CVE-2024-27199, a relative path transversal issue, has no CVSS score [ETA: it does now; it's a 7.3, which is high-severity].

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-27198
👁️

##
SophosXOps at 2024-03-07T00:46:23.898Z ##

The situation involving two TeamCity vulnerabilities, CVE-2024-27198 and CVE-2024-27199, continues to unfold. Before noting anything else, we should state that dealing with this should be a highest-priority matter for users of the company’ s on-premises CI/CD dev platform – as in, now.

##
simontsui at 2024-03-07T00:32:42.823Z ##

@BleepingComputer @tila Rapid7 indicated that CVE-2024-27199 is also being exploited in the wild https://attackerkb.com/topics/ADUie1mrpK/cve-2024-27199#exploited-in-the-wild_e28f53e6-cf6f-4b91-89be-6cb19dfd4315

##
iagox86 at 2024-03-05T21:01:48.543Z ##

If you read between the lines on the JetBrains and Rapid7 story, you'll see that JetBrains decided to cut Rapid7 out of the loop on Feb 23, but told Rapid7 that they're "still investigating" on Mar 1.

However you feel about PoCs, technical details, disclosure, etc., it's super inappropriate to lie to researchers who disclosed this to you responsibly about what your plans are.

Refs:

  • https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/
  • https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/our-approach-addressing-recently-discovered-vulnerabilities-in-teamcity-on-premises/

jbhall56 at 2024-03-05T14:04:57.755Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-27198 (CVSS score of 9.8) and CVE-2024-27199 (CVSS score of 7.3), the security defects impact the web component of TeamCity and exist because of an alternative path and a path traversal issue, respectively. https://www.securityweek.com/critical-vulnerability-exposes-teamcity-servers-to-takeover/

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-03-04T22:56:04.000Z ##

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/03/04/etr-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-jetbrains-teamcity-multiple-authentication-bypass-vulnerabilities-fixed/

##
iagox86@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-04T21:00:34.000Z ##

The Rapid7 blog on JetBrains TeamCity is SAVAGE - especially the disclosure timeline. I know from previously working on that team that we tried hard to be friendly and cooperative with vendors.

The fact that Rapid7 calls them out on their behaviour means it must have been BAD!

#vulnerabilities #poc #metasploit #cybersecurity

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-04T18:20:23.000Z ##

JetBrains security advisory affecting TeamCity. No mention of exploitation in the wild (yet).

  • CVE-2024-27198 (unknown CVSSv3 score, considered critical severity) Authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-27198 (unknown CVSSv3 score, considered high severity) Path traversal

🔗 https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2024/03/additional-critical-security-issues-affecting-teamcity-on-premises-cve-2024-27198-and-cve-2024-27199-update-to-2023-11-4-now/

Why you should care: A TeamCity vulnerability was previously exploited by Russian state-sponsored APT29 as an N-day following public disclosure.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_27198 #CVE_2024_27199

JetBrains has fixed two critical security vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-27198, CVE-2024-27199) affecting TeamCity On-Premises and is urging customers to patch them immediately as the release of technical details is imminent.

##

CVE-2024-21888
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-01-31T19:53:06.303000

12 posts

A privilege escalation vulnerability in web component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) allows a user to elevate privileges to that of an administrator.

simontsui at 2024-03-08T13:41:14.938Z ##

Check Point Research (CPR) reports on a financially motivated threat actor called Magnet Goblin, that leverages "1-day" vulnerabilities in public facing applications. This included Ivanti Connect Secure CVE-2024-21887 within 1 day of Proof of Concept. CPR attributed Magento, Qlink Sense and possibly Apache ActiveMQ campaigns to Magnet Goblin. They also discovered a Linux version of a malware called NerbianRAT, and use of the WARPWIRE JavaScript credential stealer (unknown if there are overlaps with Mandiant's UNC5325 threat actor). Magnet Goblin uses MiniNerbian (a small Linux backdoor) and RMM tools like ScreenConnect and AnyDesk. IOC provided.
🔗 https://research.checkpoint.com/2024/magnet-goblin-targets-publicly-facing-servers-using-1-day-vulnerabilities/

#MagnetGoblin #cybercrime #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2022_24086 #CVE_2023_41265 #CVE_2023_41266 #CVE_2023_48365 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #NerbianRAT #WARPWIRE #MiniNerbian #ScreenConnect #AnyDesk

##
simontsui at 2024-03-02T01:23:46.663Z ##

TechCrunch: NSA confirmed that hackers exploiting flaws in Ivanti’s widely used enterprise VPN appliance have targeted organizations across the U.S. defense sector.
🔗 https://techcrunch.com/2024/03/01/nsa-says-its-tracking-ivanti-cyberattacks-as-hackers-hit-us-defense-sector/

#cyberespionage #IOC #TTPs #UNC5325 #China #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_22024 #CISA #securityadvisory

##
simontsui at 2024-02-29T18:13:43.608Z ##

Hot off the press! CISA along with FBI, MS-ISAC, Australia ASD ACSC, NCSC-UK, NCSC-NZ, Canadian Centre for Cyber Security and CERT NZ release joint cybersecurity advisory Threat Actors Exploit Multiple Vulnerabilities in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure Gateways. It includes TTPs, IOCs, and detection methods to help network defenders mitigate risk.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa24-060b

Of particular concern, the authoring organizations and industry partners have determined that cyber threat actors are able to deceive Ivanti’s internal and external Integrity Checker Tool (ICT), resulting in a failure to detect compromise.

During multiple incident response engagements associated with this activity, CISA identified that Ivanti’s internal and previous external ICT failed to detect compromise. In addition, CISA has conducted independent research in a lab environment validating that the Ivanti ICT is not sufficient to detect compromise and that a cyber threat actor may be able to gain root-level persistence despite issuing factory resets.

The authoring organizations strongly urge all organizations to consider the significant risk of adversary access to, and persistence on, Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways when determining whether to continue operating these devices in an enterprise environment.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @deepthoughts10 @serghei @selenalarson @DaveMWilburn

#cyberespionage #IOC #TTPs #UNC5325 #China #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_22024 #CISA #securityadvisory

##
simontsui at 2024-02-28T21:15:54.019Z ##

This line from Mandiant's article stuck out to me: "In addition, we have seen the threat actor demonstrate a nuanced understanding of the appliance and their ability to subvert detection throughout this campaign."

The reason is because of the following:

The internal ICT is configured to run in two-hour intervals by default and is meant to be run in conjunction with continuous monitoring. Any malicious file system modifications made and reverted between the two-hour scan intervals would remain undetected by the ICT. When the activation and deactivation routines are performed tactfully in quick succession, it can minimize the risk of ICT detection by timing the activation routine to coincide precisely with the intended use of the BUSHWALK webshell.

This sentence also concerns me, giving me flashbacks to Eclypsium's article

An encrypted version of BUSHWALK is placed in a directory excluded by the integrity checker tool (ICT)

#cyberespionage #IOC #TTPs #UNC5325 #China #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_22024

##
simontsui at 2024-02-27T19:45:07.447Z ##

Ivanti has a related blog post regarding evolving threat actor tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs). These findings were identified in the ongoing analysis of the previously disclosed vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure and ZTA gateways, and include potential persistence techniques.
🔗 https://www.ivanti.com/blog/enhanced-external-integrity-checking-tool-to-provide-additional-visibility-and-protection-for-customers-against-evolving-threat-actor-techniques-in-relation-to-previously-disclosed-vulnerabilities

#cyberespionage #IOC #TTPs #UNC5325 #China #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #CVE_2024_21893 #CVE_2024_22024

##
simontsui at 2024-02-27T19:41:10.941Z ##

Hot off the press! Mandiant published another Ivanti Connect Secure VPN exploitation blog post outlining additional TTPs and observations for UNC5325, a suspected Chinese cyber espionage operator.
🔗 https://www.mandiant.com/resources/blog/investigating-ivanti-exploitation-persistence

cc: @campuscodi @iagox86 @brett

#cyberespionage #IOC #TTPs #UNC5325 #China #Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #UTA0178 #UNC5221 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE_2024_21888 #UNC5325

This included Ivanti Connect Secure CVE-2024-21887 within 1 day of Proof of Concept. CPR attributed Magento, Qlink Sense and possibly Apache ActiveMQ campaigns to Magnet Goblin. They also discovered a Linux version of a malware called NerbianRAT, and use of the WARPWIRE JavaScript credential stealer (unknown if there are overlaps with Mandiant's UNC5325 threat actor). Magnet Goblin uses MiniNerbian (a small Linux backdoor) and RMM tools like ScreenConnect and AnyDesk. IOC provided.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-02-29T18:13:43.000Z ##

Hot off the press! CISA along with FBI, MS-ISAC, Australia ASD ACSC, NCSC-UK, NCSC-NZ, Canadian Centre for Cyber Security and CERT NZ release joint cybersecurity advisory Threat Actors Exploit Multiple Vulnerabilities in Ivanti Connect Secure and Policy Secure Gateways. It includes TTPs, IOCs, and detection methods to help network defenders mitigate risk.
🔗 https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/cybersecurity-advisories/aa24-060b

Of particular concern, the authoring organizations and industry partners have determined that cyber threat actors are able to deceive Ivanti’s internal and external Integrity Checker Tool (ICT), resulting in a failure to detect compromise.

During multiple incident response engagements associated with this activity, CISA identified that Ivanti’s internal and previous external ICT failed to detect compromise. In addition, CISA has conducted independent research in a lab environment validating that the Ivanti ICT is not sufficient to detect compromise and that a cyber threat actor may be able to gain root-level persistence despite issuing factory resets.

The authoring organizations strongly urge all organizations to consider the significant risk of adversary access to, and persistence on, Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways when determining whether to continue operating these devices in an enterprise environment.

This line from Mandiant's article stuck out to me: "In addition, we have seen the threat actor demonstrate a nuanced understanding of the appliance and their ability to subvert detection throughout this campaign."

The reason is because of the following:

The internal ICT is configured to run in two-hour intervals by default and is meant to be run in conjunction with continuous monitoring. Any malicious file system modifications made and reverted between the two-hour scan intervals would remain undetected by the ICT. When the activation and deactivation routines are performed tactfully in quick succession, it can minimize the risk of ICT detection by timing the activation routine to coincide precisely with the intended use of the BUSHWALK webshell.

##

CVE-2024-1708
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-22T15:19:39.123000

13 posts

ConnectWise ScreenConnect 23.9.7 and prior are affected by path-traversal vulnerability, which may allow an attacker the ability to execute remote code or directly impact confidential data or critical systems.

1 repos

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/ScreenConnect-AuthBypass-RCE

H3liumb0y at 2024-03-05T09:16:48.983Z ##

"🚨 ScreenConnect Exploits Unleash ToddleShark Malware by Kimsuky 🚨"

Kimsuky, the North Korean APT, leverages vulnerabilities in ScreenConnect (CVE-2024-1708 & CVE-2024-1709) to deploy ToddleShark, aiming at espionage. This polymorphic malware uses Microsoft binaries for stealth and conducts extensive data theft. It's an evolution of Kimsuky's espionage toolkit, hinting at their refined strategies for long-term intelligence gathering. ToddleShark manipulates registry settings, employs scheduled tasks for persistence, and exfiltrates data using PEM certificates, showcasing advanced obfuscation and evasion techniques. Be vigilant and patch up!

#CyberSecurity #APT #NorthKorea #Malware #ScreenConnect #CVE2024_1708 #CVE2024_1709 #ToddleShark #Kimsuky #DataTheft #Espionage #InfoSec

Source: BleepingComputer.com

Mitre - Kimsuky

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T09:16:48.000Z ##

It's an evolution of Kimsuky's espionage toolkit, hinting at their refined strategies for long-term intelligence gathering. ToddleShark manipulates registry settings, employs scheduled tasks for persistence, and exfiltrates data using PEM certificates, showcasing advanced obfuscation and evasion techniques. Be vigilant and patch up!

##
pentesttools at 2024-02-28T12:55:44.075Z ##

🚨 Just launched: FREE scanner for #SlashAndGrab 🥷, the ConnectWise ScreenConnect vulnerabilities: https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/connectwise-screenconnect-cve-2024-1709-vulnerability-scanner

👇 Here are the specs:

When John Hammond started posting about CVE-2024-1709 (CVSSv3 10) & CVE-2024-1708 (CVSSv3 8.4), we instantly picked up on them.

Our team moved fast and added detection for both CVEs, knowing attackers are actively trying to use them (CVE-2024-1709 especially) to bypass security controls and gain unrestricted system access.

We also turned it into a FREE tool for any pentester to use: https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/connectwise-screenconnect-cve-2024-1709-vulnerability-scanner

##
todb at 2024-02-28T03:12:55.239Z ##

@austinlarsen @simontsui nbd, you're not the only one.

I'm still on the (now somewhat passive) hunt for any real evidence of exploitation for the other one. Lots of conjecture, loads of hits for CVE-2024-1709, but nothing solid for CVE-2024-1708. Every news outlet seems to just conflate the two and sometimes gets them backwards.

##
simontsui at 2024-02-27T12:45:28.527Z ##

@campuscodi one question I have is, do they even need to exploit CVE-2024-1708? With CVE-2024-1709, they create an admin user on the ScreenConnect server, giving them full control. This is a one character cheat, whereas 1708 requires user interaction and privileges (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H)

I don't specifically see it in the Trend Micro article, but is there actual evidence of CVE-2024-1708 exploitation? Since unpatched versions of ScreenConnect are vulnerable to both 1708 and 1709, it's almost certainly going to make 1709 the more valuable exploit.

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-02-27T12:34:44.000Z ##

Trend Micro says the BlackBasta and the Bl00dy ransomware gangs are now exploiting two recently disclosed ScreenConnect vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709) to breach networks and encrypt files.

https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/b/threat-actor-groups-including-black-basta-are-exploiting-recent-.html

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-02-26T12:15:05.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-26167
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-08T14:02:57.420000

4 posts

Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-03-07T20:43:52.282Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) posts 4 Chromium security advisories that were initially disclosed by Google on 05 March 2024. The new one is CVE-2024-26167 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability, which contains substantially more information than Chrome does in their advisory. It is marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely. Interestingly there's a mistake in their FAQ section, where they state both confidentiality and integrity as Low and Availability as None. However, the Metric shows C:N, I:L, A:N which scores as 4.3 medium in a CVSSv3 calculator, whereas C:L, I:L, A:N = 5.4 medium. Nitpicking but I'm all about attention to detail, especially after Microsoft botched the announcement of several exploited zero-days in the month of February 2024.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-26167

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE_2024_26167 #Chromium #spoofing

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-07T20:43:52.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) posts 4 Chromium security advisories that were initially disclosed by Google on 05 March 2024. The new one is CVE-2024-26167 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability, which contains substantially more information than Chrome does in their advisory. It is marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely. Interestingly there's a mistake in their FAQ section, where they state both confidentiality and integrity as Low and Availability as None. However, the Metric shows C:N, I:L, A:N which scores as 4.3 medium in a CVSSv3 calculator, whereas C:L, I:L, A:N = 5.4 medium. Nitpicking but I'm all about attention to detail, especially after Microsoft botched the announcement of several exploited zero-days in the month of February 2024.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-26167

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE_2024_26167 #Chromium #spoofing

##
simontsui at 2024-03-07T20:43:52.282Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) posts 4 Chromium security advisories that were initially disclosed by Google on 05 March 2024. The new one is CVE-2024-26167 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability, which contains substantially more information than Chrome does in their advisory. It is marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely. Interestingly there's a mistake in their FAQ section, where they state both confidentiality and integrity as Low and Availability as None. However, the Metric shows C:N, I:L, A:N which scores as 4.3 medium in a CVSSv3 calculator, whereas C:L, I:L, A:N = 5.4 medium. Nitpicking but I'm all about attention to detail, especially after Microsoft botched the announcement of several exploited zero-days in the month of February 2024.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-26167

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE_2024_26167 #Chromium #spoofing

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-07T20:43:52.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) posts 4 Chromium security advisories that were initially disclosed by Google on 05 March 2024. The new one is CVE-2024-26167 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge for Android Spoofing Vulnerability, which contains substantially more information than Chrome does in their advisory. It is marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely. Interestingly there's a mistake in their FAQ section, where they state both confidentiality and integrity as Low and Availability as None. However, the Metric shows C:N, I:L, A:N which scores as 4.3 medium in a CVSSv3 calculator, whereas C:L, I:L, A:N = 5.4 medium. Nitpicking but I'm all about attention to detail, especially after Microsoft botched the announcement of several exploited zero-days in the month of February 2024.
🔗 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-26167

#Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE_2024_26167 #Chromium #spoofing

CVE-2023-6000
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-01-08T15:14:56.640000

1 posts

The Popup Builder WordPress plugin before 4.2.3 does not prevent simple visitors from updating existing popups, and injecting raw JavaScript in them, which could lead to Stored XSS attacks.

1 repos

maniabel@norden.social at 2024-03-10T18:54:41.000Z ##

Veraltete Versionen des WordPress „Popup Builder“-Plugins wurden durch Hacker ausgenutzt, um Websites mit Malware zu infizieren. Die bei den Angriffen ausgenutzte Schwachstelle (CVE-2023-6000) ist eine Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS)-Sicherheitslücke, die Popup Builder-Versionen … … https://www.maniabel.de/wordpress-plugin-popup-builder-mit-sicherheitsluecke-malware-infektion/ #PlugIn #PopupBuilder #WordPress

##

CVE-2024-20321
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-04T22:45:23.647000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the External Border Gateway Protocol (eBGP) implementation of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability exists because eBGP traffic is mapped to a shared hardware rate-limiter queue. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending large amounts of network

jbhall56 at 2024-02-29T13:52:49.297Z ##

The first of the high-severity bugs, CVE-2024-20321, exists because External Border Gateway Protocol (eBGP) traffic “is mapped to a shared hardware rate-limiter queue”, allowing an unauthenticated, remote attacker to send large amounts of traffic and cause a denial-of-service (DoS) condition. https://www.securityweek.com/cisco-patches-high-severity-vulnerabilities-in-data-center-os/

##
simontsui at 2024-02-28T16:23:18.177Z ##

Cisco dropped several security advisories for FXOS and NX-OS Software, Nexus switches, and UCS:

  • CVE-2024-20321 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software External Border Gateway Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20294 (6.4 medium) Cisco FXOS and NX-OS Software Link Layer Discovery Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20291 (5.8 medium) Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches Port Channel ACL Programming Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20344 (5.3 medium) Cisco UCS 6400 and 6500 Series Fabric Interconnects Intersight Managed Mode Denial of Service Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20267 (8.6 high) Cisco NX-OS Software MPLS Encapsulated IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability

The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #securityadvisory

updated 2024-03-04T22:45:43.893000

2 posts

A vulnerability with the handling of MPLS traffic for Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause the netstack process to unexpectedly restart, which could cause the device to stop processing network traffic or to reload. This vulnerability is due to lack of proper error checking when processing an ingress MPLS frame. An attacker could exploit this vulnerabili

(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-23T09:15:22.877000

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd: fix UAF issue in ksmbd_tcp_new_connection() The race is between the handling of a new TCP connection and its disconnection. It leads to UAF on `struct tcp_transport` in ksmbd_tcp_new_connection() function.

##

CVE-2024-2173
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-06T21:42:48.053000

4 posts

Out of bounds memory access in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 122.0.6261.111 allowed a remote attacker to perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

H3liumb0y at 2024-03-07T09:34:34.108Z ##

"Update for Chrome: Enhancing Security Against Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities"

Google Chrome has recently been updated across Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms, with the latest versions being 122.0.6261.111/.112 for Windows and Mac, and 122.0.6261.111 for Linux. This update incorporates several security fixes. It addresses high issues such as memory access vulnerabilities and other potential threats. Noteworthy fixes include a high-severity out-of-bounds memory access flaw, a misimplementation in the V8 engine, and a use-after-free vulnerability in FedCM.

For users on versions before 122.0.6261.111/112, it is strongly advised to update Google Chrome to ensure protection against these vulnerabilities.

#CyberSecurity #GoogleChrome #VulnerabilityManagement #RCE #CVE20242173 #CVE20242174 #CVE20242176 #UpdateNow

For more detailed information, please refer to the official announcements on Google Chrome Releases and HKCERT. 🌍🔒🛡️

This update incorporates several security fixes. It addresses high issues such as memory access vulnerabilities and other potential threats. Noteworthy fixes include a high-severity out-of-bounds memory access flaw, a misimplementation in the V8 engine, and a use-after-free vulnerability in FedCM.

For users on versions before 122.0.6261.111/112, it is strongly advised to update Google Chrome to ensure protection against these vulnerabilities.

Google Chrome has recently been updated across Windows, Mac, and Linux platforms, with the latest versions being 122.0.6261.111/.112 for Windows and Mac, and 122.0.6261.111 for Linux. This update incorporates several security fixes. It addresses high issues such as memory access vulnerabilities and other potential threats. Noteworthy fixes include a high-severity out-of-bounds memory access flaw, a misimplementation in the V8 engine, and a use-after-free vulnerability in FedCM.

For users on versions before 122.0.6261.111/112, it is strongly advised to update Google Chrome to ensure protection against these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2024-22252
(9.3 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-05T18:50:18.333000

19 posts

VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion contain a use-after-free vulnerability in the XHCI USB controller. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host. On ESXi, the exploitation is contained within the VMX sandbox whereas, on Workstation and Fusion, this may lead to code exe

https://github.com/crackmapEZec/CVE-2024-22252-POC

VMware security advisory for VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion. No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2024-0006.html

  • CVE-2024-22252 (9.3 critical) Use-after-free vulnerability in XHCI USB controller
  • CVE-2024-22253 (9.3 critical) Use-after-free vulnerability in UHCI USB controller
  • CVE-2024-22254 (7.9 high) ESXi Out-of-bounds write vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22255 (7.1 high) Information disclosure vulnerability in UHCI USB controller

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-05T17:26:22.000Z ##

##
jbhall56 at 2024-03-06T13:05:03.118Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-22252 and CVE-2024-22253, the vulnerabilities have been described as use-after-free bugs in the XHCI USB controller. They carry a CVSS score of 9.3 for Workstation and Fusion, and 8.4 for ESXi systems. https://thehackernews.com/2024/03/vmware-issues-security-patches-for-esxi.html

##

CVE-2024-22253
(9.3 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-05T18:50:18.333000

11 posts

VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion contain a use-after-free vulnerability in the UHCI USB controller. A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host. On ESXi, the exploitation is contained within the VMX sandbox whereas, on Workstation and Fusion, this may lead to code exe

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-03-05T19:30:04.000Z ##

VMware Patches Critical ESXi Sandbox Escape Flaws https://www.securityweek.com/vmware-patches-critical-esxi-sandbox-escape-flaws/ #Malware&Threats #Vulnerabilities #CVE202422252 #CVE202422253 #VMware #ESXi

##

CVE-2024-22254
(7.9 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-05T18:50:18.333000

6 posts

VMware ESXi contains an out-of-bounds write vulnerability. A malicious actor with privileges within the VMX process may trigger an out-of-bounds write leading to an escape of the sandbox.

1 repos

https://github.com/crackmapEZec/CVE-2024-22252-POC

simontsui at 2024-03-05T17:26:22.512Z ##

  • CVE-2024-22253 (9.3 critical) Use-after-free vulnerability in UHCI USB controller
  • CVE-2024-22254 (7.9 high) ESXi Out-of-bounds write vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-22255 (7.1 high) Information disclosure vulnerability in UHCI USB controller

CVE-2024-22255
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-05T18:50:18.333000

6 posts

VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion contain an information disclosure vulnerability in the UHCI USB controller. A malicious actor with administrative access to a virtual machine may be able to exploit this issue to leak memory from the vmx process.

##

CVE-2024-20345
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the file upload functionality of Cisco AppDynamics Controller could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to conduct directory traversal attacks on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow

simontsui at 2024-03-06T16:13:03.283Z ##

Cisco security advisory for CVE-2024-20345 (6.5 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Controller Path Traversal Vulnerability could allow for directory traversal attacks by an authenticated remote attacker. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to access sensitive data on an affected device. Fixed in Cisco AppDynamics Controller Release 23.4.0. Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use.
🔗 https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-appd-traversal-m7N8mZpF

#Cisco #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_20345 #vulnerability #AppDynamicsController

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-06T16:13:03.000Z ##

Cisco security advisory for CVE-2024-20345 (6.5 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Controller Path Traversal Vulnerability could allow for directory traversal attacks by an authenticated remote attacker. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted request to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to access sensitive data on an affected device. Fixed in Cisco AppDynamics Controller Release 23.4.0. Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use.
🔗 https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-appd-traversal-m7N8mZpF

#Cisco #securityadvisory #CVE_2024_20345 #vulnerability #AppDynamicsController

##

CVE-2024-22256
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

VMware Cloud Director contains a partial information disclosure vulnerability. A malicious actor can potentially gather information about organization names based on the behavior of the instance.

simontsui at 2024-03-07T12:14:20.723Z ##

VMware security advisory for VMware Cloud Director: CVE-2024-22256 (4.3 medium) Partial Information Disclosure Vulnerability. A malicious actor can potentially gather information about organization names based on the behavior of the instance. Fixed in version 10.5.1.1. No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2024-0007.html

#VMware #CloudDirector #vulnerability #CVE_2024_22256

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-07T12:14:20.000Z ##

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-07T12:14:20.000Z ##

VMware security advisory for VMware Cloud Director: CVE-2024-22256 (4.3 medium) Partial Information Disclosure Vulnerability. A malicious actor can potentially gather information about organization names based on the behavior of the instance. Fixed in version 10.5.1.1. No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2024-0007.html

#VMware #CloudDirector #vulnerability #CVE_2024_22256

##

CVE-2024-20338
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the ISE Posture (System Scan) module of Cisco Secure Client for Linux could allow an authenticated, local attacker to elevate privileges on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to the use of an uncontrolled search path element. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by copying a malicious library file to a specific directory in the filesystem and persuading an

simontsui at 2024-03-07T12:11:32.939Z ##

Cisco released another 6 security advisories on 06 March 2024:

  • CVE-2024-20338 (7.3 high) Cisco Secure Client for Linux with ISE Posture Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20337 (8.2 high) Cisco Secure Client Carriage Return Line Feed Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20335 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business 100, 300, and 500 Series Wireless APs Command Injection Vulnerability and CVE-2024-20336 (6.5 medium) Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20301 (6.2 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20292 (4.4 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20346 (5.4 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Controller Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

##

CVE-2024-20337
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

8 posts

A vulnerability in the SAML authentication process of Cisco Secure Client could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a carriage return line feed (CRLF) injection attack against a user. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading a user to click a crafted link while establishing a VPN ses

1 repos

https://github.com/swagcraftedd/CVE-2024-20337-POC

simontsui at 2024-03-07T12:11:32.939Z ##

Cisco released another 6 security advisories on 06 March 2024:

  • CVE-2024-20338 (7.3 high) Cisco Secure Client for Linux with ISE Posture Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20337 (8.2 high) Cisco Secure Client Carriage Return Line Feed Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20335 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business 100, 300, and 500 Series Wireless APs Command Injection Vulnerability and CVE-2024-20336 (6.5 medium) Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20301 (6.2 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20292 (4.4 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20346 (5.4 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Controller Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

##
CiscoJunkie@techhub.social at 2024-03-08T22:20:54.000Z ##

Seeing lots of headlines about the latest #Cisco Secure Connect CVE (CVE-2024-20337). It's worth noting that this vulnerability requires the SAML external browser functionality to be enabled on the head-end device terminating the VPN connection. As such, this is probably only going to impact a relatively small set of AnyConnect users. (Yes, you should still try to keep your clients updated.)

##
jbhall56 at 2024-03-08T12:56:25.623Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-20337 (CVSS score: 8.2), as allowing an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a carriage return line feed (CRLF) injection attack against a user. https://thehackernews.com/2024/03/cisco-issues-patch-for-high-severity.html

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-03-08T11:25:06.000Z ##

(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Small Business 100, 300, and 500 Series Wireless APs could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform command injection attacks against an affected device. In order to exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must have valid administrative credentials for the device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-

Cisco released another 6 security advisories on 06 March 2024:

  • CVE-2024-20338 (7.3 high) Cisco Secure Client for Linux with ISE Posture Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20337 (8.2 high) Cisco Secure Client Carriage Return Line Feed Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20335 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business 100, 300, and 500 Series Wireless APs Command Injection Vulnerability and CVE-2024-20336 (6.5 medium) Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20301 (6.2 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-20346 (5.4 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Controller Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

CVE-2024-20336
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based user interface of Cisco Small Business 100, 300, and 500 Series Wireless APs could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform buffer overflow attacks against an affected device. In order to exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must have valid administrative credentials for the device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied

##

CVE-2024-20301
(6.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP could allow an authenticated, physical attacker to bypass secondary authentication and access an affected Windows device. This vulnerability is due to a failure to invalidate locally created trusted sessions after a reboot of the affected device. An attacker with primary user credentials could exploit this vulnerability by a

  • CVE-2024-20338 (7.3 high) Cisco Secure Client for Linux with ISE Posture Module Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20337 (8.2 high) Cisco Secure Client Carriage Return Line Feed Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20335 (6.5 medium) Cisco Small Business 100, 300, and 500 Series Wireless APs Command Injection Vulnerability and CVE-2024-20336 (6.5 medium) Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20301 (6.2 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20292 (4.4 medium) Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20346 (5.4 medium) Cisco AppDynamics Controller Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in these advisories.

CVE-2024-20292
(4.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-07T13:52:27.110000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the logging component of Cisco Duo Authentication for Windows Logon and RDP could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in clear text on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to improper storage of an unencrypted registry key in certain logs. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by accessing the logs on an affected system. A suc

CVE-2024-20346
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-06T21:42:54.697000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco AppDynamics Controller could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to perform a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user-supplied input by the web-based management interface. An attacker could exploit this vulnera

##

CVE-2024-1403
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-02-28T14:07:00.563000

8 posts

In OpenEdge Authentication Gateway and AdminServer prior to 11.7.19, 12.2.14, 12.8.1 on all platforms supported by the OpenEdge product, an authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified.  The vulnerability is a bypass to authentication based on a failure to properly handle username and password. Certain unexpected content passed into the credentials can lead to unauthorized access witho

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-1403

simontsui at 2024-03-06T17:10:36.577Z ##

Horizon3 provides a deep-dive and Proof of Concept for Progress OpenEdge Authentication Bypass CVE-2024-1403 (10.0 critical!, disclosed 27 February 2024 by Progress). To their credit, they describe what indicators of compromise would appear as.
🔗 https://www.horizon3.ai/attack-research/cve-2024-1403-progress-openedge-authentication-bypass-deep-dive/

cc: @campuscodi

##
simontsui at 2024-02-28T15:46:40.958Z ##

Progress security advisory: CVE-2024-1403 (10.0 critical!) authentication bypass in OpenEdge Authentication Gateway and AdminServer. The vulnerability is a bypass to authentication based on a failure to properly handle username and password. Fixed in OpenEdge LTS Update 11.7.19, 12.2.14 and 12.8.1. No mention of exploitation.
🔗 https://community.progress.com/s/article/Important-Critical-Alert-for-OpenEdge-Authentication-Gateway-and-AdminServer

cc: @campuscodi

CVE-2024-21900
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-08T21:19:43.127000

2 posts

An injection vulnerability has been reported to affect several QNAP operating system versions. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow authenticated users to execute commands via a network. We have already fixed the vulnerability in the following versions: QTS 5.1.3.2578 build 20231110 and later QuTS hero h5.1.3.2578 build 20231110 and later QuTScloud c5.1.5.2651 and later

avoidthehack at 2024-03-09T19:45:00.274Z ##

#QNAP warns of critical auth bypass flaw in its #NAS devices

QNAP disclosed three vulnerabilities that can lead to #SQL injection, command injection, and authentication bypass:

CVE-2024-21899 - authentication bypass, exploitable remotely 🚩
CVE-2024-21900 - authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands
CVE-2024-21901 - authenticated admin can inject malicious SQL commands

Updates for these vulnerabilities are available from the vendor (QNAP). If you’ve got one of these devices, #update ASAP.

#cve #cybersecurity #vulnerability

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/qnap-warns-of-critical-auth-bypass-flaw-in-its-nas-devices/

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-09T19:45:00.000Z ##

#QNAP warns of critical auth bypass flaw in its #NAS devices

QNAP disclosed three vulnerabilities that can lead to #SQL injection, command injection, and authentication bypass:

CVE-2024-21899 - authentication bypass, exploitable remotely 🚩
CVE-2024-21900 - authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands
CVE-2024-21901 - authenticated admin can inject malicious SQL commands

Updates for these vulnerabilities are available from the vendor (QNAP). If you’ve got one of these devices, #update ASAP.

##
clojure@clj.social at 2024-03-08T18:04:11.000Z ##

Clojure 1.11.2

https://clojure.org/news/2024/03/08/clojure-1-11-2

Clojure 1.11.2 and 1.12.0-alpha9 are now available. These releases include a fix for CVE CVE-2024-22871 detailed in GHSA-vr64-r9qj-h27f: CLJ-2839 - iterate, cycle, repeat - infinite seqs have infinite hashCode()

#clojure #clj #cljs !clojure@lemmy.ml @clojure@lemmy.ml

Clojure 1.11.2

https://clojure.org/news/2024/03/08/clojure-1-11-2

Clojure 1.11.2 and 1.12.0-alpha9 are now available. These releases include a fix for CVE CVE-2024-22871 detailed in GHSA-vr64-r9qj-h27f: CLJ-2839 - iterate, cycle, repeat - infinite seqs have infinite hashCode()

##

CVE-2024-23243
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-03-06T15:18:08.093000

4 posts

A privacy issue was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An app may be able to read sensitive location information.

avoidthehack at 2024-03-06T17:20:02.569Z ##

#iOS 17.4 includes 4 important #security fixes, 2 were exploited

Update ASAP.

Zero-day exploits for a kernel flaw (CVE-2024-23225) and RTKit flaw (CVE-2024-23296), both when exploited bypassed kernel memory protections have been patched by #Apple.

Also a #privacy patch included in the Accessibility feature (CVE-2024-23243); apps could read "sensitive location information" and a bug in Safari Private Browsing exposed locked tabs while switching tab groups (CVE-2024-23256).

Other security fixes are also included in iOS 17.4, but the additional CVE entries will be added later.

#cybersecurity #update #exploitation #cve

https://9to5mac.com/2024/03/05/ios-17-4-fixes-4-security-flaws/

##
simontsui at 2024-03-05T19:18:36.763Z ##

@campuscodi Apple put that information all over this security advisory, making it hard to decipher. It's an AirDrop vulnerability in Accessibility, that could allow an app to read sensitive location information (labeled as privacy issue). CVE-2024-23243 (not exploited in the wild) was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. Cristian Dinca of "Tudor Vianu" National High School of Computer Science, Romania is credited for reporting this vulnerability, great job.

#Apple #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_23243

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-03-06T17:20:02.000Z ##

#iOS 17.4 includes 4 important #security fixes, 2 were exploited

Update ASAP.

Zero-day exploits for a kernel flaw (CVE-2024-23225) and RTKit flaw (CVE-2024-23296), both when exploited bypassed kernel memory protections have been patched by #Apple.

Also a #privacy patch included in the Accessibility feature (CVE-2024-23243); apps could read "sensitive location information" and a bug in Safari Private Browsing exposed locked tabs while switching tab groups (CVE-2024-23256).

Other security fixes are also included in iOS 17.4, but the additional CVE entries will be added later.

#cybersecurity #update #exploitation #cve
